pros: Fantastic faculty and staff that truly care about you succeeding.
Great benefits, tuition exchange, flexible schedules
cons: low salary, little opportunities to be promoted

pros:

review_title: Very unprofessional administration! Do not work there!
pros: Good students and small college atmosphere.
cons: I worked at Waynesburg as faculty and was appalled at how badly they are treated! They say they want terminal degrees then get rid of professors with them for no valid reason! If a student complains, the faculty is assumed wrong and called into the provost's office and confronted. They will post the current professor's position while they still work there and not even tell them they are going to let them go. The last Provost was so bad others refused to work with her and was forced to resign. The current provost is a lawyer and unprofessional! The administration is very political and certainly does not act in a Christian manner.  In 3 years, one department has got rid of all their good professors with doctorates. If you are crazy enough to work there, make them put you on a tenure track contract immediately. They like to put new employees on one-year contracts and pressure them. The administration has frozen the tiny 1% yearly pay raises, yet the President’s and Provost are obscene compared to the size of the university. I highly recommend you find another college to work for. Don't think that things will go different for you.

pros: The people I worked with were wonderful, and they were accommodating to my school schedule and projects. I was able to become a valued member of the team, despite only being a student worker.
cons: There were not any cons to being a student worker at Waynesburg college. Though I did witness some downsides of being a professional employee.

review_title: Very Positive, Enjoyable, Treated Well, Fun place to work
pros: Good group of people that I worked with directly. Positive attitudes and always upbeat
cons: Some of the upper managers are not on the same page and therefore do not make decisions that align with each other

job_title: Program Specialist in Fort Worth, TX
pros: The students were by far the best reason to work at WU!
cons: Small town politics, not enough parking.
